ygData.subject: Re: Dress Up Wear
ygData.msgSnippet: ... Oooowwww!  I swear I just got here!   ... Erm... ye afford me to much gratitude Mik.  Ye would
ygData.messageBody:
>AOS!!!!!! Have you been lurking on this list unbeknowst to me? *thwaps her
>bud Aos*

Oooowwww! I swear I just got here! <wonders if there's a way to purge
Onelist's membership logs>

>Hey everyone, I want you to meet Aosinator Lightbringer, level 50
>cleric/wannabe tank on The Rathe and my running mate in EQ ever since P4.
>She is a VERY knowledgeable cleric and will be able to help us LOTS here on
>the list with her experience. I owe all my early patchwork and later banded
>to her wonderful sewing and smithing skills. With all the money she made,
>she was also able to buy me all my spells up to level 24. She was without a
>doubt the richest level 15 cleric you ever saw. Had over 2000 plat in the
>bank which she spent on all 6 of our group for armor and spells. I'd of
>still been in patchwork at level 24 with about 4 spells if it weren't for
>Aos. <hugs Aos tight tight>

Erm... ye afford me to much gratitude Mik. Ye would have done just fine
without me I'm sure hon. Besides, it was fun making patchwork and banded
for everyone. ;) For a cleric looking to save some money in the
beginning, i would strongly suggest tailoring as a starting skill. You can
armor yeself for relatively little money, and can save the rest of the cash
for spells. As you go up in levels, you should definitely work on
smithing, since it's relatively cheap to increase the skill to the point
where you can make banded armor with relative reliability. Besides, it's a
helluva lot cheaper than purchasing chain from the store!

>Mik (who thinks she has to behave now that she knows Aos is watching her!!
>LOL)

<covers her virgin eyes>

-Aosinator Lightbringer
-Devout follower of Mithanial Marr on The Rathe
